parameters.name: prompt
parameters.description: The positive prompt for the generation.

parameters.name: video
parameters.description: The video URL.

parameters.name: images
parameters.description: Including reference images of the element, scene, style, etc. Max 4

parameters.name: keep_original_sound
parameters.description: Select whether to keep the video original sound through the parameter

parameters.name: aspect_ratio
parameters.description: The aspect ratio of the generated video.

responseParameters.name: code
responseParameters.description: HTTP status code (e.g., 200 for success)

responseParameters.name: message
responseParameters.description: Status message (e.g., “success”)

responseParameters.name: data.id
responseParameters.description: Unique identifier for the prediction, Task Id

responseParameters.name: data.model
responseParameters.description: Model ID used for the prediction

responseParameters.name: data.outputs
responseParameters.description: Array of URLs to the generated content (empty when status is not completed)

responseParameters.name: data.urls
responseParameters.description: Object containing related API endpoints

responseParameters.name: data.urls.get
responseParameters.description: URL to retrieve the prediction result

responseParameters.name: data.has_nsfw_contents
responseParameters.description: Array of boolean values indicating NSFW detection for each output

responseParameters.name: data.status
responseParameters.description: Status of the task: created, processing, completed, or failed

responseParameters.name: data.created_at
responseParameters.description: ISO timestamp of when the request was created (e.g., “2023-04-01T12:34:56.789Z”)

responseParameters.name: data.error
responseParameters.description: Error message (empty if no error occurred)

responseParameters.name: data.timings
responseParameters.description: Object containing timing details

responseParameters.name: data.timings.inference
responseParameters.description: Inference time in milliseconds

parameters.description: List of URLs of input images for editing. The maximum number of images is 14.

parameters.description: The aspect ratio of the generated media.

parameters.description: The resolution of the output image.

parameters.name: output_format
parameters.description: The format of the output image.

parameters.name: enable_sync_mode
parameters.description: If set to true, the function will wait for the result to be generated and uploaded before returning the response. It allows you to get the result directly in the response. This property is only available through the API.

parameters.name: enable_base64_output
parameters.description: If enabled, the output will be encoded into a BASE64 string instead of a URL. This property is only available through the API.

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: The model generates video with the picture passed in as the first frame.Base64 encoded strings in data:image/jpeg; base64,{data} format for incoming images, or URLs accessible via the public network. The uploaded image needs to meet the following conditions: Format is JPG/JPEG/PNG; The aspect ratio is greater than 2:5 and less than 5:2; Short side pixels greater than 300px; The image file size cannot exceed 20MB.

parameters.name: enable_prompt_expansion
parameters.description: The model automatically optimizes incoming prompts to enhance output quality. This also activates the safety checker, which ensures content safety by detecting and filtering potential risks.

parameters.name: enable_prompt_expansion
parameters.description: The model automatically optimizes incoming prompts to enhance output quality. This also activates the safety checker, which ensures content safety by detecting and filtering potential risks.

parameters.name: go_fast
parameters.description: Prioritize faster video generation speed with a moderate trade-off in visual quality

parameters.name: speed
parameters.description: Speech speed. Range: 0.5-2.0, where 1.0 is normal speed.

parameters.name: volume
parameters.description: Speech volume. Range: 0.1-10.0, where 1.0 is normal volume.

parameters.name: pitch
parameters.description: Speech pitch. Range: -12 to 12, where 0 is normal pitch.

parameters.name: emotion
parameters.description: The emotion of the generated speech.
parameters.range:
happy, 
sad, 
angry, 
fearful, 
disgusted, 
surprised, 
neutral

parameters.name: english_normalization
parameters.description: This parameter supports English text normalization, which improves performance in number-reading scenarios.

parameters.name: sample_rate
parameters.description: Sample rate of generated sound.

parameters.name: bitrate
parameters.description: Bitrate of generated sound.

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: The number of channels of the generated audio. 1: mono, 2: stereo.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format of generated sound.

parameters.name: language_boost
parameters.description: Enhance the ability to recognize specified languages and dialects.
parameters.range:
Chinese, 
Chinese,Yue, 
English, 
Arabic, 
Russian, 
Spanish, 
French, 
Portuguese, 
German, 
Turkish, 
Dutch, 
Ukrainian, 
Vietnamese, 
Indonesian, 
Japanese, 
Italian, 
Korean, 
Thai, 
Polish, 
Romanian, 
Greek, 
Czech, 
Finnish, 
Hindi, 
auto

parameters.name: data
parameters.description:
URL to zip archive with images. Try to use at least 4 images in general the more the better.

        In addition to images the archive can contain text files with captions. Each text file should have the same name as the image file it corresponds to.

parameters.name: trigger_word
parameters.description:
Trigger word to be used in the captions. If None, a trigger word will not be used.
        If no captions are provide the trigger_word will be used instead of captions. If captions are the trigger word will not be used.

parameters.description: Number of steps to train the LoRA on.

parameters.name: speed
parameters.description: Speech speed. Range: 0.5-2.0, where 1.0 is normal speed.

parameters.name: volume
parameters.description: Speech volume. Range: 0.1-10.0, where 1.0 is normal volume.

parameters.name: pitch
parameters.description: Speech pitch. Range: -12 to 12, where 0 is normal pitch.

parameters.name: emotion
parameters.description: The emotion of the generated speech.
parameters.range:
happy, 
sad, 
angry, 
fearful, 
disgusted, 
surprised, 
neutral

parameters.name: english_normalization
parameters.description: This parameter supports English text normalization, which improves performance in number-reading scenarios.

parameters.name: sample_rate
parameters.description: Sample rate of generated sound.

parameters.name: bitrate
parameters.description: Bitrate of generated sound.

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: The number of channels of the generated audio. 1: mono, 2: stereo.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format of generated sound.

parameters.name: language_boost
parameters.description: Enhance the ability to recognize specified languages and dialects.
parameters.range:
Chinese, 
Chinese,Yue, 
English, 
Arabic, 
Russian, 
Spanish, 
French, 
Portuguese, 
German, 
Turkish, 
Dutch, 
Ukrainian, 
Vietnamese, 
Indonesian, 
Japanese, 
Italian, 
Korean, 
Thai, 
Polish, 
Romanian, 
Greek, 
Czech, 
Finnish, 
Hindi, 
auto

parameters.name: enable_sync_mode
parameters.description: If set to true, the function will wait for the result to be generated and uploaded before returning the response. It allows you to get the result directly in the response. This property is only available through the API.

responseParameters.name: code
responseParameters.description: HTTP status code (e.g., 200 for success)

responseParameters.name: message
responseParameters.description: Status message (e.g., “success”)

responseParameters.name: data.id
responseParameters.description: Unique identifier for the prediction, Task Id

responseParameters.name: data.model
responseParameters.description: Model ID used for the prediction

responseParameters.name: data.outputs
responseParameters.description: Array of URLs to the generated content (empty when status is not completed)

responseParameters.name: data.urls
responseParameters.description: Object containing related API endpoints

responseParameters.name: data.urls.get
responseParameters.description: URL to retrieve the prediction result

responseParameters.name: data.has_nsfw_contents
responseParameters.description: Array of boolean values indicating NSFW detection for each output

responseParameters.name: data.status
responseParameters.description: Status of the task: created, processing, completed, or failed

responseParameters.name: data.created_at
responseParameters.description: ISO timestamp of when the request was created (e.g., “2023-04-01T12:34:56.789Z”)

responseParameters.name: data.error
responseParameters.description: Error message (empty if no error occurred)

responseParameters.name: data.timings
responseParameters.description: Object containing timing details

responseParameters.name: data.timings.inference
responseParameters.description: Inference time in milliseconds

parameters.name: prompt
parameters.description: The positive prompt for the generation.

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: First frame of the video; Supported image formats include.jpg/.jpeg/.png; The image file size cannot exceed 10MB, and the image resolution should not be less than 300*300px, and the aspect ratio of the image should be between 1:2.5 ~ 2.5:1.

parameters.name: resolution
parameters.description: Video quality (360p/540p/720p/1080p).

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: Video duration in seconds. 1080p only supports 5 seconds.

parameters.name: negative_prompt
parameters.description: The negative prompt for the generation.

parameters.name: seed
parameters.description: The random seed to use for the generation.

parameters.name: prompt
parameters.description: The positive prompt for the generation.

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: The model generates video with the picture passed in as the first frame.Base64 encoded strings in data:image/jpeg; base64,{data} format for incoming images, or URLs accessible via the public network. The uploaded image needs to meet the following conditions: Format is JPG/JPEG/PNG; The aspect ratio is greater than 2:5 and less than 5:2; Short side pixels greater than 300px; The image file size cannot exceed 20MB.

parameters.name: end_image
parameters.description: The model generates video with the picture passed in as the last frame.Base64 encoded strings in data:image/jpeg; base64,{data} format for incoming images, or URLs accessible via the public network. The uploaded image needs to meet the following conditions: Format is JPG/JPEG/PNG; The aspect ratio is greater than 2:5 and less than 5:2; Short side pixels greater than 300px; The image file size cannot exceed 20MB.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The duration of the generated media in seconds.

parameters.name: enable_prompt_expansion
parameters.description: The model automatically optimizes incoming prompts to enhance output quality. This also activates the safety checker, which ensures content safety by detecting and filtering potential risks.

parameters.name: prompt
parameters.description: The positive prompt for the generation.

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: The model generates video with the picture passed in as the first frame.Base64 encoded strings in data:image/jpeg; base64,{data} format for incoming images, or URLs accessible via the public network. The uploaded image needs to meet the following conditions: Format is JPG/JPEG/PNG; The aspect ratio is greater than 2:5 and less than 5:2; Short side pixels greater than 300px; The image file size cannot exceed 20MB.

parameters.name: end_image
parameters.description: The model generates video with the picture passed in as the first frame.Base64 encoded strings in data:image/jpeg; base64,{data} format for incoming images, or URLs accessible via the public network. The uploaded image needs to meet the following conditions: Format is JPG/JPEG/PNG; The aspect ratio is greater than 2:5 and less than 5:2; Short side pixels greater than 300px; The image file size cannot exceed 20MB.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The duration of the generated media in seconds.

parameters.name: enable_prompt_expansion
parameters.description: The model automatically optimizes incoming prompts to enhance output quality. This also activates the safety checker, which ensures content safety by detecting and filtering potential risks.

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: An image to be used as the start frame of the generated video. Requirements: 1. Only accepts 1 image; 2. Supports solo portraits (female/male) in photorealistic or anime-style only; 3. Optimal results with half-body or full-body shots; 4. Images can be provided via URLs or Base64 encode; 5. Supported codecs: PNG, JPEG, JPG, WebP; 6. Image aspect ratio must be less than 1:4 or 4:1; 7. Maximum file size: 50MB; 8. Base64 decode length must be under 50MB with appropriate content type string.

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: An image to be used as the start frame of the generated video. Requirements: 1. Only accepts 1 image; 2. Supports single-person photos in realistic or anime style; 3. Best results when the person is fully visible from above the thighs; 4. Images can be provided via URLs or Base64 encode; 5. Supported codecs: PNG, JPEG, JPG, WebP; 6. Image aspect ratio must be less than 1:4 or 4:1; 7. Maximum file size: 50MB; 8. Base64 decode length must be under 50MB with appropriate content type string.

parameters.name: lyric
parameters.description: Each paragraph represents a segment starting with a structure tag and ending with a blank line, each line is a sentence without punctuation, segments [intro], [inst], [outro] should not contain lyrics, while [verse], [chorus], and [bridge] require lyrics.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: Song Description (Optional). Describe the gender, timbre, genre, emotion, instrument and bpm of the song. Only English is supported currently.

parameters.name: prompt_audio
parameters.description: Prompt Audio (Optional). Provide a URL to an audio file that serves as a prompt for the genre of the song generation.

parameters.name: genre
parameters.description: Genre Select (Optional). Choose a genre for the song.
parameters.range:
Pop, 
R&B, 
Dance, 
Jazz, 
Folk, 
Rock, 
Chinese Style, 
Chinese Tradition, 
Metal, 
Reggae, 
Chinese Opera, 
Auto

parameters.name: guidance_scale
parameters.description: The guidance scale to use for the generation.

parameters.name: temperature
parameters.description: The temperature to use for the generation. A higher value means more randomness in the output.

parameters.name: top_k
parameters.description: The top-k value to use for the generation. This controls the number of highest probability vocabulary tokens to keep for top-k-filtering.

parameters.name: seed
parameters.description: The random seed to use for the generation. -1 means a random seed will be used.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description:
URL to zip archive with images. Try to use at least 4 images in general the more the better.

        In addition to images the archive can contain text files with captions. Each text file should have the same name as the image file it corresponds to.

parameters.name: trigger_word
parameters.description:
Trigger word to be used in the captions. If None, a trigger word will not be used.
        If no captions are provide the trigger_word will be used instead of captions. If captions are the trigger word will not be used.

parameters.name: steps
parameters.description: Number of steps to train the LoRA on.

parameters.name: audio
parameters.description: The uploaded file is cloned and supports formats such as MP3, M4A, and WAV.

parameters.name: custom_voice_id
parameters.description: Custom user-defined ID. Minimum 8 characters; must include letters and numbers and start with a letter (e.g., WaveSpeed001). Duplicate voice-ids will throw an error.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: Specify the TTS model to be used for the preview. This is only a preview after cloning. Once the model is generated, any Minimax Turbo or HD voice model can be used for inference.
parameters.range:
speech-02-hd, 
speech-02-turbo, 
speech-2.5-hd-preview, 
speech-2.5-turbo-preview, 
speech-2.6-hd, 
speech-2.6-turbo

parameters.name: need_noise_reduction
parameters.description: Enable noise reduction. Default is false (no noise reduction).

parameters.name: need_volume_normalization
parameters.description: Specify whether to enable volume normalization. If not provided, the default value is false.

parameters.name: accuracy
parameters.description: Uploading this parameter will set the text validation accuracy threshold, with a value range of [0,1]. If not provided, the default value for this parameter is 0.7.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Text for audio preview. Limited to 2000 characters.
parameters.default: Hello! Welcome to Wavespeed! This is a preview of your cloned voice. I hope you enjoy it!

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: An image to be used as the start frame of the generated video. Requirements: 1. Only accepts 1 image; 2. Only supports dual-person group photos and dual-person collages; 3. Better results are achieved with clear, half-body frontal shots; 4. Images can be provided via URLs or Base64 encode; 5. Supported codecs: PNG, JPEG, JPG, WebP; 6. Image aspect ratio must be less than 1:4 or 4:1; 7. Maximum file size: 50MB; 8. Base64 decode length must be under 50MB with appropriate content type string.

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: An image to be used as the start frame of the generated video. Requirements: 1. Only accepts 1 image; 2. Only supports dual-person photo; 3. Full-body photo of two subjects with visible feet and thighs for better results; 4. Images can be provided via URLs or Base64 encode; 5. Supported codecs: PNG, JPEG, JPG, WebP; 6. Image aspect ratio must be less than 1:4 or 4:1; 7. Maximum file size: 50MB; 8. Base64 decode length must be under 50MB with appropriate content type string.

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: An image to be used as the start frame of the generated video. Requirements: 1. Only accepts 1 image; 2. Only supports realistic or anime-style single female photos; 3. Best results when the subject is shown from the front and includes at least the upper body or the full body; 4. Images can be provided via URLs or Base64 encode; 5. Supported codecs: PNG, JPEG, JPG, WebP; 6. Image aspect ratio must be less than 1:4 or 4:1; 7. Maximum file size: 50MB; 8. Base64 decode length must be under 50MB with appropriate content type string.

Base64 decode length must be under 50MB with appropriate content type string.

parameters.name: lyrics
parameters.description: Lyrics with optional formatting. You can use a newline to separate each line of lyrics. You can use two newlines to add a pause between lines. You can use double hash marks (##) at the beginning and end of the lyrics to add accompaniment. Maximum 350 to 400 characters.

parameters.name: bitrate
parameters.description: Bitrate for the generated music

parameters.name: sample_rate
parameters.description: Sample rate for the generated music

parameters.name: song
parameters.description: Reference song, should contain music and vocals. Must be a .wav or .mp3 file longer than 15 seconds.

parameters.name: voice
parameters.description: Voice reference. Must be a .wav or .mp3 file longer than 15 seconds. If only a voice reference is given, an a cappella vocal hum will be generated.

parameters.name: instrumental
parameters.description: Instrumental reference. Must be a .wav or .mp3 file longer than 15 seconds. If only an instrumental reference is given, a track without vocals will be generated.

parameters.description: An image to be used as the start frame of the generated video. Requirements: 1. Only accepts 1 image; 2. Only supports realistic-style single-person photos; 3. Best results achieved with full-body shots and scenic backgrounds; 4. Images can be provided via URLs or Base64 encode; 5. Supported codecs: PNG, JPEG, JPG, WebP; 6. Image aspect ratio must be less than 1:4 or 4:1; 7. Maximum file size: 50MB; 8. Base64 decode length must be under 50MB with appropriate content type string.

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: An image to be used as the start frame of the generated video. Requirements: 1. Only accepts 1 image; 2. Supports single-subject, dual-subject, and multi-subject in realistic style characters and animals; 3. Best results achieved when subjects are fully visible and not too close to each other; 4. Images can be provided via URLs or Base64 encode; 5. Supported codecs: PNG, JPEG, JPG, WebP; 6. Image aspect ratio must be less than 1:4 or 4:1; 7. Maximum file size: 50MB; 8. Base64 decode length must be under 50MB with appropriate content type string.

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: An image to be used for creating auto-spin video. Requirements: 1. Only accepts 1 image; 2. Only supports product images; 3. Better results when the subject is shown in close-up, medium, or long-range shots; 4. Images can be provided via URLs or Base64 encode; 5. Supported codecs: PNG, JPEG, JPG, WebP; 6. Image aspect ratio must be less than 1:4 or 4:1; 7. Maximum file size: 50MB; 8. Base64 decode length must be under 50MB with appropriate content type string.

parameters.description: Custom user-defined ID. Minimum 8 characters; must include letters and numbers and start with a letter (e.g., WaveSpeed001). Duplicate voice-ids will throw an error.

parameters.description: Text for audio preview. Limited to 500 characters.
parameters.default: Hello! Welcome to Wavespeed! This is a preview of your cloned voice. I hope you enjoy it

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: An image to be used for creating auto-spin video. Requirements: 1. Only accepts 1 image; 2. Only supports product images; 3. Better results when the subject is shown in close-up, medium, or long-range shots; 4. Images can be provided via URLs or Base64 encode; 5. Supported codecs: PNG, JPEG, JPG, WebP; 6. Image aspect ratio must be less than 1:4 or 4:1; 7. Maximum file size: 50MB; 8. Base64 decode length must be under 50MB with appropriate content type string.

Roger,

Alice, 
Matilda, 
Will, 
Jessica, 
Eric, 
Chris, 
Brian, 
Daniel, 
Lily, 
Bill

parameters.name: similarity
parameters.description: High enhancement boosts overall voice clarity and target speaker similarity. Very high values can cause artifacts, so adjusting this setting to find the optimal value is encouraged.

parameters.name: stability
parameters.description: Voice stability (0-1) Default value: 0.5

parameters.name: use_speaker_boost
parameters.description: This parameter supports English text normalization, which improves performance in number-reading scenarios.

parameters.name: audio
parameters.description: The URL pointing to the audio file that will be used for generating synchronized lip movements. Supported audio file formats: .mp3/.wav/.m4a/.aac, with a maximum file size of 5MB.

parameters.name: video
parameters.description: The URL of the video file for generating synchronized lip movements. Video files support .mp4/.mov, file size does not exceed 100MB, video length does not exceed 10s and is not shorter than 2s, only 720p and 1080p are supported, length and width dimensions should both be between 720px and 1920px.

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: The model generates video with the picture passed in as the first frame.Base64 encoded strings in data:image/jpeg; base64,{data} format for incoming images, or URLs accessible via the public network. The uploaded image needs to meet the following conditions: Format is JPG/JPEG/PNG; The aspect ratio is greater than 2:5 and less than 5:2; Short side pixels greater than 300px; The image file size cannot exceed 20MB.

parameters.name: duration
parameters.description: The duration of the generated media in seconds.

parameters.name: enable_prompt_expansion
parameters.description: The model automatically optimizes incoming prompts to enhance output quality. This also activates the safety checker, which ensures content safety by detecting and filtering potential risks.

parameters.name: go_fast
parameters.description: Prioritize faster video generation speed with a moderate trade-off in visual quality

parameters.description: If set to true, the function will wait for the result to be generated and uploaded before returning the response. It allows you to get the result directly in the response. This property is only available through the API.

parameters.name: speed
parameters.description: Speech speed. Range: 0.5-2.0, where 1.0 is normal speed.

parameters.name: volume
parameters.description: Speech volume. Range: 0.1-10.0, where 1.0 is normal volume.

parameters.name: pitch
parameters.description: Speech pitch. Range: -12 to 12, where 0 is normal pitch.

parameters.name: emotion
parameters.description: The emotion of the generated speech.
parameters.range:
happy, 
sad, 
angry, 
fearful, 
disgusted, 
surprised, 
neutral

parameters.name: english_normalization
parameters.description: This parameter supports English text normalization, which improves performance in number-reading scenarios.

parameters.name: sample_rate
parameters.description: Sample rate of generated sound.

parameters.name: bitrate
parameters.description: Bitrate of generated sound.

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: The number of channels of the generated audio. 1: mono, 2: stereo.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format of generated sound.

parameters.name: language_boost
parameters.description: Enhance the ability to recognize specified languages and dialects.
parameters.range:
Chinese, 
Chinese,Yue, 
English, 
Arabic, 
Russian, 
Spanish, 
French, 
Portuguese, 
German, 
Turkish, 
Dutch, 
Ukrainian, 
Vietnamese,

parameters.name: enable_base64_output
parameters.description: If enabled, the output will be encoded into a BASE64 string instead of a URL. This property is only available through the API.

parameters.name: enable_sync_mode
parameters.description: If set to true, the function will wait for the result to be generated and uploaded before returning the response. It allows you to get the result directly in the response. This property is only available through the API.

responseParameters.name: code
responseParameters.description: HTTP status code (e.g., 200 for success)

responseParameters.name: message
responseParameters.description: Status message (e.g., “success”)

responseParameters.name: data.id
responseParameters.description: Unique identifier for the prediction, Task Id

responseParameters.name: data.model
responseParameters.description: Model ID used for the prediction

responseParameters.name: data.outputs
responseParameters.description: Array of URLs to the generated content (empty when status is not completed)

responseParameters.name: data.urls
responseParameters.description: Object containing related API endpoints

responseParameters.name: data.urls.get
responseParameters.description: URL to retrieve the prediction result

responseParameters.name: data.has_nsfw_contents
responseParameters.description: Array of boolean values indicating NSFW detection for each output

responseParameters.name: data.status
responseParameters.description: Status of the task: created, processing, completed, or failed

responseParameters.name: data.created_at
responseParameters.description: ISO timestamp of when the request was created (e.g., “2023-04-01T12:34:56.789Z”)

responseParameters.name: data.error
responseParameters.description: Error message (empty if no error occurred)

responseParameters.name: data.timings
responseParameters.description: Object containing timing details

responseParameters.name: data.timings.inference
responseParameters.description: Inference time in milliseconds

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: Text to convert to speech. Every character is 1 token. Maximum 10000 characters. Use <#x#> between words to control pause duration (0.01-99.99s).

parameters.name: voice_id
parameters.description: Desired voice ID. Use a voice ID you have trained (https://wavespeed.ai/models/minimax/voice-clone), or one of the following system voice IDs: Wise_Woman, Friendly_Person, Inspirational_girl, Deep_Voice_Man, Calm_Woman, Casual_Guy, Lively_Girl, Patient_Man, Young_Knight, Determined_Man, Lovely_Girl, Decent_Boy, Imposing_Manner, Elegant_Man, Abbess, Sweet_Girl_2, Exuberant_Girl.

parameters.name: speed
parameters.description: Speech speed. Range: 0.5-2.0, where 1.0 is normal speed.

parameters.name: volume
parameters.description: Speech volume. Range: 0.1-10.0, where 1.0 is normal volume.

parameters.name: pitch
parameters.description: Speech pitch. Range: -12 to 12, where 0 is normal pitch.

parameters.name: emotion
parameters.description: The emotion of the generated speech.
parameters.range:
happy, 
sad, 
angry, 
fearful, 
disgusted, 
surprised, 
neutral

parameters.name: english_normalization
parameters.description: This parameter supports English text normalization, which improves performance in number-reading scenarios.

parameters.name: sample_rate
parameters.description: Sample rate of generated sound.

parameters.name: bitrate
parameters.description: Bitrate of generated sound.

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: The number of channels of the generated audio. 1: mono, 2: stereo.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Format of generated sound.

parameters.name: language_boost
parameters.description: Enhance the ability to recognize specified languages and dialects.

parameters.name: enable_sync_mode
parameters.description: If set to true, the function will wait for the result to be generated and uploaded before returning the response. It allows you to get the result directly in the response. This property is only available through the API.

responseParameters.name: code
responseParameters.description: HTTP status code (e.g., 200 for success)

responseParameters.name: message
responseParameters.description: Status message (e.g., “success”)

responseParameters.name: data.id
responseParameters.description: Unique identifier for the prediction, Task Id

responseParameters.name: data.model
responseParameters.description: Model ID used for the prediction

responseParameters.name: data.outputs
responseParameters.description: Array of URLs to the generated content (empty when status is not completed)

responseParameters.name: data.urls
responseParameters.description: Object containing related API endpoints

responseParameters.name: data.urls.get
responseParameters.description: URL to retrieve the prediction result

responseParameters.name: data.has_nsfw_contents
responseParameters.description: Array of boolean values indicating NSFW detection for each output

responseParameters.name: data.status
responseParameters.description: Status of the task: created, processing, completed, or failed

responseParameters.name: data.created_at
responseParameters.description: ISO timestamp of when the request was created (e.g., “2023-04-01T12:34:56.789Z”)

responseParameters.name: data.error
responseParameters.description: Error message (empty if no error occurred)

responseParameters.name: data.timings
responseParameters.description: Object containing timing details

responseParameters.name: data.timings.inference
responseParameters.description: Inference time in milliseconds

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: An image to be used as the start frame of the generated video. Requirements: 1. Only accepts 1 image; 2. Supports single or double subjects; 3. Best results when subjects are not holding any props; 4. Images can be provided via URLs or Base64 encode; 5. Supported codecs: PNG, JPEG, JPG, WebP; 6. Image aspect ratio must be less than 1:4 or 4:1; 7. Maximum file size: 50MB; 8. Base64 decode length must be under 50MB with appropriate content type string.

The effect is better when the image contains a single subject; 4. Images can be provided via URLs or Base64 encode; 5. Supported codecs: PNG, JPEG, JPG, WebP; 6. Image aspect ratio must be less than 1:4 or 4:1; 7. Maximum file size: 50MB; 8. Base64 decode length must be under 50MB with appropriate content type string.

parameters.description: An image to be used as the start frame of the generated video. Requirements: 1. Only accepts 1 image; 2. Only single person supported; 3. Better results with headshot photos above the shoulders, without revealing clothes; 4. Images can be provided via URLs or Base64 encode; 5. Supported codecs: PNG, JPEG, JPG, WebP; 6. Image aspect ratio must be less than 1:4 or 4:1; 7. Maximum file size: 50MB; 8. Base64 decode length must be under 50MB with appropriate content type string.

parameters.name: system_prompt
parameters.description: System prompt to provide context or instructions to the model

parameters.name: reasoning
parameters.description: Should reasoning be the part of the final answer.

parameters.name: priority
parameters.description: Throughput is the default and is recommended for most use cases. Latency is recommended for use cases where low latency is important.

parameters.name: temperature
parameters.description: This setting influences the variety in the model’s responses. Lower values lead to more predictable and typical responses, while higher values encourage more diverse and less common responses. At 0, the model always gives the same response for a given input.

parameters.name: max_tokens
parameters.description: This sets the upper limit for the number of tokens the model can generate in response. It won’t produce more than this limit. The maximum value is the context length minus the prompt length.

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: Name of the model to use. Premium models are charged at 10x the rate of standard models, they include: deepseek/deepseek-r1, google/gemini-pro-1.5, openai/gpt-4.1, anthropic/claude-3-5-haiku, openai/gpt-4o, anthropic/claude-3.5-sonnet, openai/o3, meta-llama/llama-3.2-90b-vision-instruct, anthropic/claude-3.7-sonnet, openai/gpt-5-chat.

parameters.name: enable_sync_mode
parameters.description: If set to true, the function will wait for the result to be generated and uploaded before returning the response. It allows you to get the result directly in the response. This property is only available through the API.

responseParameters.name: code
responseParameters.description: HTTP status code (e.g., 200 for success)

responseParameters.description: Model ID used for the prediction

responseParameters.description: Array of URLs to the generated content (empty when status is not completed)

responseParameters.description: Object containing related API endpoints

responseParameters.description: Status of the task: created, processing, completed, or failed

responseParameters.description: ISO timestamp of when the request was created (e.g., “2023-04-01T12:34:56.789Z”)

responseParameters.description: Inference time in milliseconds

parameters.description: If set to true, the function will wait for the result to be generated and uploaded before returning the response. It allows you to get the result directly in the response. This property is only available through the API.

parameters.description: The model generates video with the picture passed in as the first frame.Base64 encoded strings in data:image/jpeg; base64,{data} format for incoming images, or URLs accessible via the public network. The uploaded image needs to meet the following conditions: Format is JPG/JPEG/PNG; The aspect ratio is greater than 2:5 and less than 5:2; Short side pixels greater than 300px; The image file size cannot exceed 20MB.

parameters.name: end_image
parameters.description: The model generates video with the picture passed in as the last frame.Base64 encoded strings in data:image/jpeg; base64,{data} format for incoming images, or URLs accessible via the public network. The uploaded image needs to meet the following conditions: Format is JPG/JPEG/PNG; The aspect ratio is greater than 2:5 and less than 5:2; Short side pixels greater than 300px; The image file size cannot exceed 20MB.
